result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D. Boyd Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: Defendant placed on a payment plan of $25 a month beginning 1/5/2017
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment/full time schooling or a combination of the two.

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  Def is to obtain anger management counseling and to complete recommended treatment;  with the Def finding the funding for such counseling.
  Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

NO CONTACT WITH ASHLAND WALMART.   
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Granted Good Time.
Granted Work Release.
Concurrent with: Ashland County Case 16CM116
Financial obligations as previously ordered to be paid through the Clerk of Courts Office and a civil judgment is entered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
